channel.title: Plugged in, Not Charging! - How do i fix?
channel.description:
Hi i have a HP G60-213EM and i recently re-installed my operating system (Windows 7 - Home Premium).
I was running the exact same Operating system previously without any issues to battery life. However today when i plugged my charger in i noticed that the battery was not going up and was just staying at 13%. When i hovered over the icon i saw this text displayed 13% Availible (plugged in, not charging) This has only started doing this today but it kinda defeats the object of me having a portable PC if i cant unplug it.
Does anybody know how to fix this.
I have tried Flashing my BIOS and restarting my Laptop, Taking the battery out. I cant find any other solutions on google though.
Any help will be greatfully recieved.
Thanks

item.title: Plugged in, Not Charging! - How do i fix?
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:8, topic:353521”]On Ubuntu, it tells you your battery’s actual capacity and actual charge. If the battery’s capacity has been reduced to 13%, obviously you’ll need a new battery.

If the capacity is still high you probably need a replacement charger. This happened to my brothers Dell, and I can fix it sometimes if I wiggle the cables around a bit. I read somewhere that some of the strands of cable in the wire can easily snap when the wire is bent, and after a certain amount snap the voltage drops below a threshold which stops the computer from charging the battery. I also read something about interference with the data pin in the charging cable, so you could unplug your everything for a while to let static discharge then plug it back in with the cable away from other electronics.

If getting a new charger doesn’t work, the chip on the motherboard that detects the chargers data pin is probably damaged. I thought this was a Dell only problem… but I guess not =/[/quote]Yer you have to wiggle it and it works for a while, That crap cost me over 80£ on charger’s…

Read full topic
item.source: Plugged in, Not Charging! - How do i fix?

item.title: Plugged in, Not Charging! - How do i fix?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Does the laptop power on with the battery removed? If so, more likely to be the battery itself than the charging circuit, though you can’t really rule either out without a meter. How old is the battery?

EDIT: And of course try a different charger like the above guy said.

Read full topic
item.source: Plugged in, Not Charging! - How do i fix?

item.title: Plugged in, Not Charging! - How do i fix?
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

On Ubuntu, it tells you your battery’s actual capacity and actual charge. If the battery’s capacity has been reduced to 13%, obviously you’ll need a new battery.

If the capacity is still high you probably need a replacement charger. This happened to my brothers Dell, and I can fix it sometimes if I wiggle the cables around a bit. I read somewhere that some of the strands of cable in the wire can easily snap when the wire is bent, and after a certain amount snap the voltage drops below a threshold which stops the computer from charging the battery. I also read something about interference with the data pin in the charging cable, so you could unplug your everything for a while to let static discharge then plug it back in with the cable away from other electronics.

If getting a new charger doesn’t work, the chip on the motherboard that detects the chargers data pin is probably damaged. I thought this was a Dell only problem… but I guess not =/

Read full topic
item.source: Plugged in, Not Charging! - How do i fix?

item.title: Plugged in, Not Charging! - How do i fix?
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

Or the battery is going bad depends. How long have you had the battery and how often do you use it off the charger.

Read full topic

I was running the exact same Operating system previously without any issues to battery life. However today when i plugged my charger in i noticed that the battery was not going up and was just staying at 13%. When i hovered over the icon i saw this text displayed

Does anybody know how to fix this.

Any help will be greatfully recieved.
